intro: Santiria tessmannii, commonly known as the African sandalwood, is a small evergreen shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, dark green leaves and small white flowers. The plant produces small, round, woody fruits that contain a single seed. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its slow growth and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
